meanings.definition: Irregular or thick parts in yarn or fabric.
meanings.sent1: The sweater had noticeable slubbings in the fabric, giving it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: She carefully inspected the yarn, looking for any slubbings that could affect the quality of her knitting.
meanings.sent3: The slubbings in the fabric seemed to play hide and seek, popping up unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The slubbings in the yarn were like little surprises, adding character to the final product.
meanings.sent5: The slubbings in the fabric stood out like tiny bumps, creating a tactile experience.

meanings.definition: To make yarn or fabric with irregular or thick parts.
meanings.sent1: She slubbings the yarn by intentionally adding thicker sections for a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The artisan carefully slubbings the fabric, creating a textured masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: He slubbings the yarn with a mischievous grin, knowing it would add charm to his creation.
meanings.sent4: The designer slubbings the fabric with precision, turning it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: They slubbings the yarn with care, ensuring each thick section was placed thoughtfully.
